definition: a musical instrument that consists of two small round pieces of wood that you hold in the hand and hit together with the fingers to make a noise. Castanets are used especially by Spanish dancers.

used as a friendly way of addressing somebody, especially between men

a position in which one player cannot prevent their king (= the most important piece) being captured and therefore loses the game
a situation in which somebody has been completely defeated
a musical instrument that has a round wooden frame, sometimes covered with plastic or skin, with metal discs around the edge. To play it you shake it or hit it with your hand.
not done or made well or with skill

easy to control; willing to be influenced by somebody/something

pleasant; friendly and easy to like

able to live both on land and in water
involving soldiers landing at a place from the sea
suitable for use on land or water
a round building without a roof and with rows of seats that rise in steps around an open space. Amphitheatres were used especially in ancient Greece and Rome for public entertainments.
a room, hall or theatre with rows of seats that rise in steps
an open space that is surrounded by high sloping land
enough or more than enough
large, often in an attractive way

funny and giving pleasure

weak and not having much effect
a drug that makes a person or an animal unable to feel anything, especially pain, either in the whole body or in a part of the body
